criteria.description: Reward function properly executes the expression and checks to see if the expression equals 24.
criteria.justification: Expression is safely evaluated via AST; reward peaks at 1.0 when value equals 24, and metrics record distance to 24.

criteria.description: Reward function makes sure that the expression uses all four digits exactly once.
criteria.justification: validate_solution compares sorted numbers used to the puzzle digits, enforcing exact usage including duplicates.

criteria.description: Environment and prompting is setup to elicit thinking / reasoning in a <thinking> tag or equivalent.
criteria.justification: Prompt instructs to respond only with <solution> XML containing the expression; no thinking or reasoning tag is requested or parsed.

criteria.description: Reward function is smooth, with positive reward for being close to 24.
criteria.justification: Uses exponential shaping exp(-|24 - value|/24) for valid solutions, yielding positive rewards when close.

criteria.description: Penalty for not following the demanded formatting, or reward for following it.
criteria.justification: Non-XML responses are penalized (invalid XML -> invalid -> -1 reward). The code attempts to enforce <solution> root tag as well.

notes: Strong safety in expression evaluation and digit-usage validation; smooth shaping present. No mechanism to elicit or capture <thinking> content; formatting enforcement exists but raising ValueError on wrong tag may surface as an exception rather than a clean penalty.
